reviews.review: Unfortunatley, this game is in the same boat as Deathmatch Classic. By that, I mean that they are both really fun games, but because theres no one online, you should not buy them.

Seriously one of the best hidden gems from Valve. Super fun to just mess around in with some friends, and the TRON-like visuals look pretty good for GoldSource. Please Valve, give us a sequel in Source 2 or even Source.

After a few more years of practice I will be good enough to be pro. Everyone should get this game because it is so good and nobody can ever enjoy themselves unless they play this game.

REVIEW
Ricochet
You've played for 104 hours
Would you recommend this game to other players?  Yes No
Please describe what you liked or disliked about this product and whether you recommend it to others. Please remember to be polite and follow the Rules and Guidelines. A description is required to post your recommendation.

Playing Ricochet is essential to the growth of a human being. If you haven't, I absolutely recommend picking up and playing Ricochet.

While you're at it, please ask Valve to finish and release Ricochet 2. It could very much become the best video game released in history, and I would like to experience that.

tl;dr: Ricochet is a fun game and we should revive it.

The purpose of this game is to throw discs at each other. Sounds simple and stupid, but Ricochet is a fun game if players are online. The first match of Ricochet I played was with two other people. There was Player and someone else. It was in the server, “Original Ricochet,” which is a server with no modded maps, just the vanilla maps like rc_deathmatch. Of course, the modded maps are good, but the original maps just feel a bit better. I stopped playing for a while because my ping was in the thousands but that stopped. I attempted to convince my friend to get it, but he just didn’t feel like wasting his money on a game from 2000. You may think I am dumb for playing this game for 2.4 hours (at the time of this review) but, why shouldn’t I waste my time on a game from 21 years ago? Together, we can revive Ricochet, a seemingly simple game that is actually fun.

What I think people who are not in the Ricochet player base need to understand is that playing Ricochet isn't just something we do. It's ingrained into our lives. Many people, these days, are perfectly content with sitting on their computers all day playing single player games. I used to be a casual gamer and I used to do this. After joining the Ricochet gamer base, playing Ricochet became a new norm that was ingrained into my life. We need it for our wellbeing. It helps us escape society. There have even been studies that show how necessary tossing frisbees in a virtual environment is for our wellbeing. The fact that it was stripped away from us, especially by something that barely affects us specifically is very detrimental to our mental state. People are giving us so much crap for it, yet they don't know what it's like for us to be deprived of everything that's fun for us. Here is the truth, there are people out there myself included that don't think anyone is a gamer unless they are "Ricochet gamers". We would never in a thousand years waste our time playing a single player game as a Ricochet gamer. People that play single player games, are not really gamers to us Ricochet gamers... they are tourists. We Ricochet gamers spend hrs looking up configs, exploits and load outs, playing at low settings on 144+ hz monitors with 1000hz polling rate mice, we are extremely competitive. The definition of casual gaming to a Ricochet game is: playing single player games on ultra settings. a casual gamer plays for the escape, not the destruction of others. and to us, a casual gamer is not a gamer. Ricochet toxic players are not more toxic to casual players than other players, it might be that you are sensitive. if you can be trolled to the point you are not having a good time, you need to turn within. harden up. Some people are more sensitive than others, maybe stay single player.. keep in mind to some of us 2 hrs a day of Ricochet is not gaming, its warming up.

Ricochet is probably Valve's least-known game. As a Half-Life mod, Ricochet's gameplay and creativity were absolutely outstanding at the time. Inspired by the famous arcade game Discs of Tron from 1982, this game pioneers the same fun and inventive gameplay.

The gameplay of this game is really interesting. But as a mod game based on Half-Life, it is destined to limit it. Unfamous is also its biggest disadvantage, not to mention now, even if there are very few people who have played or even understood this game before. It's hard to play the game again now. Great for a collection in your library.
It's valve's worst title, but valve doesn't make any bad games

POV: You bought the Valve Complete Pack
Jokes aside, this is basically the reason why most people own this game in recent time, then there are some people who played a lot..
Anyway, should you buy it? Not unless it's on a sale, you have people to play it with, or you buy the Valve Pack, there is literally no other reason, the servers are empty, and there is most likely a total of 10 or so servers. The game itself is quite nice, you throw shiny frisbees at other people while getting yeeted by some glowing dorito triangle pad.
All in all dead game with some nice mechanics. 8/10

È un gioco multiplayer basato sullo stesso motore grafico di half life, dei giocatori (se ci sono) devono uccidersi o buttarsi giù nel vuoto usando anelli (controllate i miei screenshot per capire meglio o video su Youtube). Piccolo trivia: questo gioco è più vecchio di me ...

Sconsiglio questo gioco principalmente perché non ha più giocatori, i server sono tutti vuoti e raramente c'è qualcuno, di solito dall'altra parte dell'Oceano Atlantico quindi la latenza non è delle migliori.

Il gameplay è monotono e ripetitivo, l'idea di base è carina e originale ma non si può creare un intero videogioco solo su questa idea.

Voto: [b]4[/b]
